title: Fantastic  care
body: Absolutely  fantastic  care from everyone  at Rowley Hall Hospital. Had a total knee  replacement,  from entering  the hospital  to be greeted  from the friendly but professional  receptionist,  to meeting the nursing staff,  who's care was second to none,  nothing was to much trouble,  physio explained everything  regarding exercises and why I needed to do them. Catering  staff made sure I had a gluten  free diet even offered  me some food that was not on the menu.

title: Amazing Staff
body: I was a day case and overnight admission to ward b1. The staff showed their professional  care, compassion and general friendliness throughout. I have mo complaints only praise and fond memories from the way I and other patients in my ward were treated. God Bless you all.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely practice
body:
Everyone in this practice has never been anything other than polite and helpful. 
It genuinely feels like reception staff go the extra mile to find the best appointment for you. They are never rude, or make you feel like you’re wasting their time. 
I always receive good communication; if my prescription needs to be checked I am contacted, if I am due a medication review, they inform me. 
The doctors are all fantastic as well. Polite, friendly, they listen attentively and try to get to the route of whatever the issue is. 
I am so glad I moved to Marlborough; and a huge part of this is being able to register with this Doctor Surgery as they have been a complete change to my previous experiences elsewhere.

title: Friendly practice
body: I find overall the staff are friendly, helpful and welcoming, also I have multiple medical issues and Doctors, nurses and staff have equipment me and my family with on going support and nutrition, medical information to better maintain my medical conditions, Also have a strong impact regarding my care and wellbeing in recovery. Thank you Grantham centre Practice

title: Excellent Practice
body: Felt that they had my interests and concerns   At the heart of my appointment.the doctor was very professional and also displayed a very human touch. Thank you very much for the advice and explanation .

title: Exemplary
body: I attended for a cortisone injection. I have been in a great deal of pain. Nothing was too much trouble. I felt at ease; everything was explained. Dr S and her colleague who was in attendance were highly professional, engaging and genuinely interested in me as an individual. I was advised clearly about self-care. When I mentioned associated symptoms they were addressed and further appointments offered and confirmed. Wonderful!

title: Excellent treatment
body: I was treated as an emergency patient in the Victoria Eye Unit. Throughout the whole six weeks before I was discharged every member of staff, regardless of grade, treated me with a smile, compassion, and reassurance. I noted that this was so across the board with other patients, even under extreme pressure. The technical excellence was of the highest standard and the outcome achieved what I had been advised was possible. As a result my quality of life has been greatly improved.

title: Very Impressive Clinic
body:
I went to the CHEC Clinic at Accrington for my eye appointments and was very impressed. The building is bright and modern, local for me and plenty of parking.
The staff are nice and friendly and very efficient.

title: Very efficient service
body: Having had to deal with other GP practices on behalf of my parents, I have to say how absolutely brilliant St John's are in comparison. I've recently had an issue and the team (GP, nurses & pharmacist) all dealt with my swiftly and efficiently - a fabulous service.

title: Amazing practice
body: I highly recommend this practice, the receptionists are friendly, cheerful and helpful, I was seen by an amazing doctor who had given me plenty of advice and help, then seen by other doctors who had done the exact same, the surgery itself is kept clean. After my issues with previous gp practices I was amazed at the quick response by the team at Hall Green my whole family are with them and we absolutely would say it is an amazing practice because the staff are amazing and attentive to all their patients

title: Professional, caring staff
body: Stayed on holiday in a nearby village, needed a routine procedure carried out for 3 days out of the week. All staff were welcoming, friendly and caring at every visit. Appointments were made to fit around my holiday.

title: The best surgery
body: I was seen same day I rang,amazing consult,understood how poorly I feel and went above and beyond to get me the tests I needed,she listened and at no point did I feel rushed ,I'm truly lucky to have such a amazing practice, everyone works as a team to provide the best outcome x

title: Excellent service.
body: The receptionist was polite. I did not not have to wait long before seeing the doctor. The doctor was both professional and understanding. And the advice given was most helpful.

title: Satisfactory
body: The doctor was competent and confident. I got appointment quickly. Satisfied with outcome. Follow up letter received immediately.

title: Understanding and caring
body: I landed myself into a situation on Wednesday night leading to me taking control and phoning for an ambulance. It was all in all a great service despite the nhs being under a lot of stress. From the beginning, the dispatcher on the end of the phone was very patient and kind with me, and efficiently sent out an ambulance to come to my rescue. The ambulance turned up about half an hour after making the phone call so very efficient. The ambulance crew were so so lovely and compassionate and I could not stress enough how safe and protected and cared for I felt while in the back of the ambulance. They were extremely patient with me and they were very dedicated in their job making me feel comfortable and safe. Creds to these two ambulance crew members, you know who you are! I almost feel quite emotional at how kindly I was treated by them and they listened to me and weren’t afraid to have a conversation with me despite the circumstances. They were person centred which made my ambulance journey fairly pleasant. Brilliant service, I hope that all ambulance crews are as kind and dedicated as this crew that I was lucky enough to be under the care of. Keep doing what you’re doing. It’s a challenging and stressful job but the ambulance crews are so amazing at saving people’s lives, no matter how tough it gets. Hats off to all the ambulance crew out they’re doing what they’re doing.

title: Amazing service
body:
I would like to provide feedback regarding two recent call outs when my father was unwell. 
I cannot thank both the ambulance service and the paramedics enough. The staff were really polite and explained everything well. During the second incident we had the service out within minutes and at the hospital very quickly. Thank you for all your support. A big thanks to these staff who do a remarkable job helping people like us when we need them the most.

title: Great service
body:
I attended yesterday for an injection in my hand. I was treated extremely well by the Practitioner, who explained the procedure to me, including risks and benefits,  checked whether I had any questions, and then gave me the injection in a sensitive part of my hand well. She advised me about what to expect and that she would make contact in a couple of weeks to see how I was.
Overall, this was an excellent experience from a good clinician. 
Thank you and well done.

title: Very responsive support
body: I recently had severe knee pain. I rang the surgery early in the morning and the very helpful receptionist booked me in with a nurse practitioner in the early afternoon. She was very responsive and directed me for a walk-in X-ray at St Mary's, which was done later in the afternoon with very little waiting. Over the last twenty years I have found all the staff, reception, nurses and doctors at this practice to be sympathetic, courteous and helpful.

title: Brilliant practice
body: Every member of staff including the doctors are extremely pleasant and easy to communicate with. I would recommend this surgery to anyone. Nothing is ever too much for them to help you with anything. They deserve recognition

title: Excellent Care
body: I came to a&e on bank holiday Monday as my atrial flutter had started become uncomfortable for me. The doctor I saw at the front door reception area was very reassuring and the nurse wearing a white uniform was brilliant took my blood from my arm and done an ecg., they were both very kind, both caring and offered me alot of reassurance. I could not believe how busy it was and Id like to say You do not get enough credit for your hard work. So thank you so much.

title: Good experience
body:
Had an early appointment with the Nurse.
Lovely and relaxed made me feel comfortable about 
the procedure which I had done.
Thank you.

author: kitt
title: Caring GP
body: All health services feel under pressure, and it feels nerve wracking going for an appointment and wondering if you will get the care you need. The GP was warm and interested- she really cared. She explained her treatment plan clearly, and she managed unexpected information carefully.

author: Glasgow Children's Hospital user
title: no female toilets in the children's hospital in Glasgow
body:
My young daughter was attending an appointment at Queen Elizabeth Children's Hospital in Glasgow (May 2023). We were both appalled to be told that there are no female toilets and all have been designated as mixed sex. This poses a very serious safeguarding risk to all the children attending the hospital. It also meant that every cubicle either had urine over the toilet seat or the toilet seat was left up and we had use our hands to pull down. This is unacceptable. It also breaches the single sex legislation which is a protected characteristic under the Equalities Act.  
Given this is a children's hospital the decision to remove all female toilets is even more confounding. This could be very easily remedied by designating some of the cubicles female, some male and some mixed. Please can this change be made to ensure that girls and women attending the hospital have the dignity of a clean and safe toilet.

title: Disappointment after disappointment after…
body:
I consider myself to be in fairly good health and so rarely need to visit the GP. And thank goodness. Because with a service such as the one you receive at Lister Medical Centre, you would be glad. 

My 2.5 year old however hasn't been so lucky. Last year he was blighted with tonsilitis 7 times. Each time he contracted it, we were in a situation where we would call for an appointment only for all the slots to be taken and would then have to call 111 to see my own GP. Every time, without fail. We are now in the process of having my son referred for ASD - and I can't even make a routine appointment. All the appointments for the next 3 weeks are taken. 

You are failing the people in your care as the people in your care can't even make an appointment. This isn't a health service. It's a failure and a joke.

title: Really bad practice
body:
When I booked my quarterly B 12 Injection which was slightly overdew they gave me a time and date, the following morning the surgery rang me to ask me what my booking was for (oh dear). I then got a text message telling me it had been cancelled.When I rang the surgery to book another appointment I was told I would have to go on a waiting list, I am still waiting, it is now a month overdew.When  I went to collect my prescription today it wasn't all there the diabetic medication was missing.The pharmacy told me the surgery hadn't ordered it. I know I ordered because it was on my printout. So I rang the surgery to find out why they hadn't passed the order through to the pharmacy, the receptionist was no help what so ever could get no sense out of her.I shall just have to wait until I fall into a coma and let A & E sort me out. At the meeting I had with the medical staff some weeks ago they told me the changes proposed would not effect Fieldview surgery ( oh yes they have ) and the aim was to provide a better service, they've failed. It also takes millennia  for anyone to answer the phone.
The staff seem to think they're working in a green grocers rather than a Doctors Surgery.All very sad really Fieldview surgery use to be highly regarded amongst it patients.

title: Ridiculous
body: I have been waiting for months for help with my mental health. The team at this hospital have repeatedly let me down- due to their failure to do their jobs my health is suffering. I have been waiting for over 3 months for an appointment with a nurse, months for therapy, have only been seen my random duty workers when I’m in a crisis.I have been left alone to deal with my own health.  As a person with mental health issues this is damaging .

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Excellent communication
body:
My stay has been okay, everything has been alright. The nurses are really good, the communication is excellent, the staff give great advice and have been really comforting and empathetic.  
The food is okay, my appetite hasn't been that great. Not a bad stay at all in 4 south.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: Saw GP 30 minutes after phone call requesting appointment. GP listened carefully then carried out checks. Discovered irregular pulse. Saw nurse for ECG immediately and then back for consultation with doctor.  Atrial fibrillation confirmed and medication prescribed and explained carefully. I had no idea I had this condition and only vigilant checks revealed it. All within 50 minutes of initial appointment.  Brilliant, empathetic doctor.  Follow up appointment given to monitor me. Cannot speak highly enough about this practice. Not the first time excellent service has been given to me. Thank you most sincerely.

title: Nobody answering the phone
body:
I’ve tried 3 times and approx 30 mins each time. Nobody picks up the phone!  Is there anyone on reception? I had a scan in March, wanted to know results. How do I find out if I can’t reach by phone?
Thanks

title: Phone system appalling
body:
Appalling phone system as unable to even join a phone queue to book a more urgent appointment from 8:30am....and now the same is true for routine nurse appointments from 2pm. Only option is to go to the practice in person, which is highly inconvenient, or impossible for those at work all day or for some of those more vulnerable in our community. This also increases spread of illness, which in turn will increase the demand placed on the practice further.

I understand where they don't have the capacity to deal with inbound calls which results in long queues, as they don't have an unlimited budget....but someone has made the decision to run the phone system this way, resulting in a phone lottery, and the prospect of not being able to get through at all...which makes it preventable, and therefore unforgivable, given it's health and in some instances life or death.

Please rectify this, or employ someone that can....thank you.

author: pugpad05
title: My future looks so different from when I started last year
body:
I always knew that I suffered from anxiety and was really shocked when I was diagnosed with PTSD. I approached Thurrock IAPT for help and support when I was in a really vulnerable and scary situation. At the time I was homeless and living in a shelter and badly suffering. I found it difficult to talk to anyone or leave my room, my mind was a mess which left me hopeless and isolated. I simply could not see any future, I was backed into a tight corner struggling to breathe and it was exhausting.  
I self referred to Thurrock and I found everyone who works in the organisation to be so friendly and caring, from the people who answer the phones to the therapists who do the initial assessment and in particular the one that helped me.  
I did have to wait a few months for treatment, as I received EMDR specific for PTSD. During that period there was many times I felt extremely low and full of fear but every time I called the office, the staff were so supportive and empathetic which really helped me and eased my panic.  
I was in treatment for seven months and had the most understanding and trustworthy therapist who knew I was fearful of the treatment and reliving the past. The therapist was always kind, thoughtful, professional and approachable - at all times I felt safe, heard and guided at a pace I could cope with. That safety and guidance helped me to revisit the horrors of my past, that I thought I had neatly stored away in a box, deep inside but had a habit of popping open, when I least expected it and completely disrupting my life. I realised that I had no control over those horrors, they were in fact controlling me. Whenever they did pop up as nightmares or flashbacks, I was often frozen in fear and honestly felt like someone was stabbing me in the stomach. Even during normal times when I thought they were locked away, they were always lurking in the background, so when I was feeling a little low or down, they would just make me feel so much more vulnerable, fearful and needy. Life had pushed me into a corner whereby I was more frightened of continuing to live with the horrors of the past than I was of opening up the closed box and now I am so glad that happened.  
At times the treatment was hard and painful but I can honestly say the best thing that I have ever done for myself. My fear of the EMDR treatment was so unnecessary as my therapist gave me some useful tools to deal with my thoughts and feelings in between our sessions. The reliving that I feared the most was actually recalling images and allowing my mind to freely flow from image to image. I do not know the science of how it works I just know that it helped me form new perspectives and beliefs, which finally removed the horror from my memories. The EMDR also helped me with my anxiety and has given me a powerful tool to use when things start to become unmanageable.  
The best thing of all is that it is absolutely free to anyone who lives in Thurrock and I know I can go back and ask for help if things become too much. I would urge anyone who is suffering to reach out and get some help - no-one has to suffer alone or in silence.  
My future looks so different from when I started last year - because I have hope. Thank you so much I am deeply grateful.

author: xrayjs39
title: The nurses made me feel very safe
body:
I had HPV1 and testing for other sexually transmitted infections (STIs) after being raped.  
The nurses made me feel very safe, I was nervous at first but once you’re in there it feels very relaxed.

author: Neevy
title: Overcrowded and dirty ward, patients needs not met .
body:
Arrived A&E via GP 12 noon - seen by a nurse who was lovely. At 1:00pm bloods were taken, seen doc around 1:45pm went for X-rays. Got admitted to A&E ward and all I can say was like a war zone .  
Every bay taken up around 10 of us on chairs receiving drips etc . Very unsafe environment men pulling drips out of arms and leaving blood everywhere. One bathroom to share - I am immunosuppressant and meant to have a bay for treatment of my own never mind share a toilet. I sat on the same chair from 3:00 pm until I finally got a bay bed at 1:00am I was never offered tea or anything in this whole time I was in.  
I finally got a bed on the ward - this wasn’t even a room, it was a bed in the corridor with a screen around it. The toilet was out of the ward which you had to wait for nurse to buzz you in and out. Again, a shared bathroom which I should not be allowed to use. I do not blame nurses as they are worked to hard, just not enough staff for the people coming in. I saw someone being pushed in on a chair, hood up. He took his socks off as these were soaked and was not checked once in all the time I was there. He was walking around, his obs were never done, it was like he wasn’t even there. I don’t know his illnesses etc. but basic human needs is to check on your patient even give him a blanket to keep warm and a hot drink - not left like he was on the street. What has happened to our A&E departments?  
I also have just recovered from breast cancer and said lots of times not to do blood pressure tests on my left arm due to lymph nodes removed but each time they went to use this arm . Common sense would of been maybe to put a note on my notes . I still can't believe it. I am shocked & sad.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: mayrt94
title: Difficulty getting appointments
body:
I have not been able to get any kind of appointment, but on my 12-month review I told the nurse I have been really tired. I have always had a FBC, which I thought was standard, but this wasn't done. I complained and was told they don't do this for BP. Obviously not looked at my records.  
This has always been a standard procedure, but I believe they are cutting costs and patients' health is coming second. I have arranged a blood test elsewhere as it's important, and when you ring up you are told no appointments, ring 8 am tomorrow.

author: Archie2244
title: Everything was a shambles
body:
I came to Queens Hospital, due to having severe pain in my knees and pins and needles in my feet. I spoke with NHS 111 who recommended that I come to A&E.  
Upon arriving, everything was a shambles, we were told there was only 1 doctor for illness and non for injury, but they carried on streaming patients.  
After checking in and waiting in the queue for an hour I was called back to the checkpoint by one of the nurses to do my observations, leaving the streaming queue. I was told to go back to the queue only then to have my observations done again. Therefore losing my spot and 3 patients who were after me got streamed first, which made no sense.  
Eventually I got streamed by a doctor and was told I would be examined by a doctor at The Partnership of East London Cooperatives (PELC).  
Fast forward 6 hours I am still waiting as I am writing this review. In the early hours of the morning, the receptionist told some patients that they were going home and so was the doctor therefore to go elsewhere. They caused a state of panic for everyone who had been waiting 5 hours or more. They shut the blinds down and the doctor came out shouting. The security guards came and the receptionist said they were being abused, which was utter nonsense.  
We told the security guards that there are 20 witnesses and not one person abused them, they merely asked what was going on as they had caused a state of panic by putting out a statement that the doctor and reception staff are going home. They proceeded cover up their mistakes and walked out leaving 50+ patients to fend for themselves. Nowhere to ask for help, no one to speak to and no one to tell us what is going on.  
The communication skills of this department is non existent and extremely disappointing. I feel PELC have ruined what once was a decent hospital. It's an absolute disaster here!  
I feel the A&E area needs to be opened up again.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

author: verily_r
title: Partial hearing loss - reassurance
body:
The last few months or so I've had partial hearing loss with tinnitus, that kind of high-pitched ringing that can drive you a little mad. I'd dismissed it as ear wax, but it wasn't resolving. I use a CPAP machine and started to worry that the pressure might have caused damage or inflammation, as I've always been sensitive to that kind of thing and it does sometimes make my ears pop.  
Eventually, I rang my GP but couldn't get an appointment, however they did book me in for a syringing or the modern equivalent (I'm grateful they still offer the service). The problem, I was supposed to be using ear drops and they were doing nothing as far as I could tell, and I was getting increasingly worried that if it wasn't just a blockage, I might be further damaging my ear by using ear drops (I have a family history of hearing loss, I don't know if it's genetic though, hopefully not!). If I didn't use the ear drops though, they likely wouldn't go ahead with the syringing...  
I tried anywhere I could think of to just get someone to look, pharmacy, specsavers, I rang again for a GP appointment but there weren't any available for almost a month (after the syringing). I'll admit I was getting worried. I finally rang 111, it took a day but they put me through to an out of hours GP, and I finally got an appointment at York hospital to see a GP that evening.  
The whole thing took maybe 5 minutes, a quick check and yep it's blocked, ear drops should be fine and hopefully the cleaning appointment will resolve the issue. It sounds silly really, to worry over ear wax, but my hearing is incredibly important to me (I'm one of those idiots who spends far too much money on fancy audio equipment). I just had this vision of a ruptured ear drum and drops seeping inside, ridiculous, but unnerving nonetheless!  
I wanted to write this, as I'm sure GPs see trivial issues like this all the time, and perhaps don't necessarily understand why the patient is so worried. From the patients perspective though, it can be genuinely scary not quite knowing what's going on, and that reassurance is invaluable. I really would like to offer my thanks to the 111 team, and the service at York hospital that offered excellent care. Now, I'm just hoping the syringing gets rid of the blasted tinnitus!

author: earmarktm44
title: Poor home care service
body:
We paid for Caremark to do 2 x 30 minute visits for my mum who has dementia. This was to help with meals, medication and to provide company on days when myself or my wife were unable to be there due to work.  
We became very concerned when we discovered that the majority of the time, the carers visits were well short of this. On many occasions, they were there for only 5 or 10 minutes.  
I challenged Caremark about this a number of times and received no response.  
After a year, we cancelled the agreement and moved to another company who have been brilliant. When I again challenged the manager of Caremark in person, they dismissed my complaint and said that was how it is for everyone. When I asked if they thought that it was ok to charge a woman in her late eighties for care they did not provide, they shrugged their shoulders and were completely dismissive.  
I presented Caremark with a bill for the shortfall in the care provided, which they have refused to pay.

author: Jesjw84
title: Appointment booking system
body:
The online website does not work like the receptionist insist they do. Everytime I need a appointment I have to fight for it playing fastest finger first. Last time I got a appointment it was to get my breasts checked and I had to go into the surgery as I could not even get a placement to be in the telephone queue, (this was after calling everyday for 3 days) this was roughly 6 weeks ago. Now bring on today at the start of June - Again trying to get an appointment for a few days now.  
Was on hold for 53 minutes for the receptionist to hang up on me as I did not respond to them when they said hello. 53 minutes waiting for an appointment for my mental health, to then be hanged up on. Called back and waited an hour on hold to then be told no appointments. I asked for the complaints email which I was told is on the website. No, it is not on the website  
Sort out your staff members on the phone - it's disgraceful that I can never get a appointment.

title: Gp surgery
body: I was in a middle of a sentence when the person handling my call put the phone down on me. I was not rude, I had a happy tone and I only had their number and just wanted the number of the skeletal  teams number who are in the same building and apart of the nhs . This person handling my call most probably  didn't know what I wanted as they  didn't give me time of day, listened or wanted to help , if this is what they are like before you get in the door I wouldn't recommend  this gp practice very unfriendly,  plus I wasn't rude to this person but this person their whole tone  and action was not great to begin with as they answered the phone but that is ok I guess.

title: Absolutely awful
body: I was made to wait 45 minutes for my appointment even though the practice was empty. When I was eventually seen, I was made to feel like a hindrance and that I was wasting their time, even tho i was only there at the drs request, not my own.  I found the service from start to finish unfriendly, unprofessional and insulting.

title: Best care & practice
body: My experience at the Pinn Medical Centre was amazing as usual, the care that I received not just today but always is 100%. The best surgery

title: Brilliant practice
body: As always dealt with my problems quickly through ask my GP would definitely recommend brilliant service

title: Always at least 30 minutes late and rude…
body:
I was only seen 35 minutes after my appointment booking, which would be fine had the doctor/receptionists been apologetic and explained why they were late.

However, not even an apology was given when I told the doctor how long I’d been waiting, but simply the dismissive comment of “I’ve had people with very serious problems in”, insinuating my appointment was less valid and unimportant.

In addition to this, multiple members of staff walked past me in the waiting room and completely ignored me, not even a smile. I would appreciate this if the clinic was extremely busy, however not a single other person was in the waiting room, and about 3 nurses who could have seen me instead were just stood chatting to each other in the reception area for the entire duration I was waiting.

title: Compassion and Outstanding Staff
body:
Following my recent and devastating loss of my wife Irene Tunstall on Sunday 28/5/2023, on behalf of myself and my family I feel that is important to acknowledge the magnificent care and support from all of the staff on Ward 16 at the University Hospital of North Durham.

During this difficult time, they were outstanding in helping us cope with the situation we were facing, and their unwavering compassion, dignity, guidance and professionalism were second to none.

It is always tough to witness the final chapter in a loved one’s life, but with all of the staff of Ward 16 it was a final chapter that was made acceptable and allowed us to come to terms with the outcome.

We will never forget the care, help and sympathy they showed towards us in this 
very emotional time.

With the very deepest gratitude.

David and Family.

title: Great care
body:
Although hard to get through on the phone once through you get lovely receptionists who do their best to help. Managed to get a call back and was called down to see the locum who was a lovely chap
Needs a bit of tlc in the rooms to be honest but it’s still great care

author: Daughter with concerns
title: My mum was admitted to ward 102
body:
My mum was admitted to ward 102 from the HDU following having severe pneumonia. While her care was OK on the whole, given that she was quite confused it was very upsetting that during her stay several things went missing we believe they were stolen from her when she was in a vulnerable state.  
Her mobile, toiletries gifted by a friend and moisturiser which I brought in for her. It was a stressful time for mum so I did not immediately report this though I wouldn't like the same to happen to any other vulnerable older person so I will be reporting this to the police.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: No communication with parents
body:
Sadly I wish I could leave a better review, I think this facility could truly be great. It seems many staff members make a real effort with the children, making pizzas, bike rides, take away night - fantastic! 

Sadly the communication lets it down spectacularly. Since my child was admitted here, we were given absolutely no details whatsoever. We do not know who her care coordinator is, much less have we spoken to them. They have meeting in relation to your child without even considering parental views/concerns - you not only are not part of the process, you won’t even know they are happening! 

Even the bare essentials are not communicated such as when your child is coming home, whether they will discharged. Literally anything at all. When questioned regarding this, they point to ‘confidentiality’ however this should not apply to taking parental views! 

We feel the psychiatry at this hospital requires some intervention too, sadly.

title: Unhelpful, rude and condescending staff
body:
I have been having issues for 3 years regarding woman issues. I have watched it myself and begged for help which I was ignored.
I also suffer from another condition that needs a referral and they refuse to do it for me. I rang up reception this week asking for a refferal to go private and was told I need to speak to a doctor and ring up in the morning with the emergency list. I explained the doctors have my notes so should be able to write it without me taking an appointment. Today 200calls in regarding my woman issue which was never resolved and a referral letter I was treated with so much disrespect. I was sent for bloods after I was told what I was experiencing was due to something bloods can only tell. When I then went on about my referral letter I was spoke down to by the GP was told I could not afford it, told the price, told I'm practically do not understand  even though it is not their place to put their opinion on it. I then stated I have insurance and was told to call back to clarify it with the insurance. What a waste of time and resources getting diagnosed through a telephone is the new norm and refusal of letters to go private becuase of bias due to my age and gender.

title: Bad practice from management
body:
Over the last few weeks we have had between 3 and 5 delivery's a week. This week it will be 7 days. Prescription says 12, lucky if we get 2 at the minute. 
This means we are house bound and husband having to stay sat doing nothing. Oxygen needed to walk. 
 A full fact find should be done with regard to this company's actions and bills been sent out to NHS. 
Technicians do a great job and having to tell customers we can't supply your requirement today just because someone at the top has not made provisions. 
Apparently all customers were informed before this upgrade commenced, sorry but we was not informed and in my opinion they should have out sourced or lost the contract. Enough is enough this company is putting lives at risk.

title: Outstanding professional, caring and…
body: My mother received outstanding care. The staff were professional, and worked as a team seamlessly. She was cared for with compassion and although speed was of the essence everything was explained clearly and calmly. Although we hope not to require your assistance again we are confident that if we do we will be in safe hands. Thank you.

author: Anonmrs71
title: Physio sessions
body: Back at physio again with the lovely Louise. I have MS and it is now progressive so referred back - been to and fro over last probably 17 years have had. Always feel very comfortable and looked after so well. Its always never a stress to have an appointment because of the friendliness of the physios at PRI and in particular Louise. I often get tired and there is understanding that I might not always manage all the exercises so never feel pressured but completely comfortable to trust all advice given .

readBy.name: Perth and Kinross Health & Social Care Partnership

author: pilingsnm48
title: Stroke Care
body: I suffered an ischemic stroke 7 weeks ago. No recollection of it happening until the paramedics arrived & took me to the stroke unit at QMC.

links.id: i felt that i mattered and not just a number

author: Sunflowe
title: Great care
body:
My husband spent 3 week in icu and the care he was given was exceptional by everyone within the department. At a time when myself and my family thought we were going to lose a loved one they acted in a professional and humane manner at all times. We as a family will never forget the care given to our loved one and we would like the opportunity to thank you all.  
Thank you each and every one of you.  
You are all truly amazing.

author: peppercb88
title: Implant replacement
body: I had my implant replacement and had an sti testing and the nurse I had was lovely and made me feel comfortable.

author: antliagw49
title: Day surgery
body:
I was admitted for day surgery. I felt very nervous on arrival but the warm welcome from all the staff soon put me at ease. I was treated exceptionally well throughout the day and cannot thank and praise every member of staff I came in to contact with. Procedures were explained at all times and everyone else I saw received the same kindness, warmth and sometimes funny treatment from the staff. Having a laugh certainly puts you at your ease.  
Before today lots of people had said how amazing the hospital is and I can only echo those words.  
Thank you to everyone of the staff.

author: nm11
title: Compassionate and kind team
body: I was blown away by the kindness of all the staff in MAU in Daisy Hill. Midwife Phil & Dr Anita were so kind and went out of their way to help me as well as the rest of the team there today. Thank you.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Terrible signage - but helpful staff
body: I advise bringing big ball of string and tying it to car door handle before entering hospital.  Signage terrible, levels confusing.  Took 15 mins to find way out  from Radiology to Sandford Rd car park. But whenever we stopped and looked puzzled a member of staff unfailingly came over to ask if they could help us.  But even they had difficulty explaining.  By the way -brilliant staff in Radiology - so kind and efficient!

author: Sunflowe
title: Great care and many laughs
body:
Just like to thank all staff in b11 for all the care given to me during my stay .  
I was on the for 2 weeks and all the staff were excellent.  
Great care and banter.

author: RaggedyAnn
title: My colposcopy experience
body:
Dr McAlpine-Scott was so caring, kind, considerate and explained each step of the procedure before, during and after the procedure and she did my smear test to save me having to go to my surgery which I am always very anxious about.  
Laura was lovely too and helped me relax and be comfortable. First class service. I thought I was at a private hospital. I am very grateful.

author: decemberct63
title: Implant removal
body:
I had a good experience overall at the clinic. The nurse was excellent; professional but in a friendly manner when asking questions, performing the procedure and giving advice.
Luckily I was able to be seen, even though I was late to my appointment due to there being no parking at the clinic, and difficulty finding the site on foot from the nearest parking.

author: zuluxr75
title: Contraception removal
body: My daughter felt heard and grateful Knowing someone was there too help and listen and not judge her

title: Based on my experience today
body:
Based on my experience today which is my first time booking through What’s App.
The process is very slow. I was given an appointment at 12:34 compared to if I had called the front desk at 8am. My reply time would be even slower on days when I have work. I do not have time to be on my phone constantly answer 21 questions.

The questions asked to get an appointment was relevant.

From the time the conversation started to the time when I got the appointment was too long.

title: Helpful and quick
body: I was running out of my medications and the gp was quick to help out with sorting out my medications .

title: Great Practice
body: A good experience on my first visit to this practice, made possible by the very friendly and helpful staff, thanks.

title: Awful service
body: Non-urgent apps are more than a month away and so reception tell you to call up at 8am the next day instead for an urgent appointment. When you do this, you have to dial 50 times before getting in the queue and then all the slots for today are taken by about 8.20am. In general, the doctors are great when you manage to see them, but the service as a whole compared to other GP practices is just unacceptable.

title: Impossible to get appointment
body: Probably some great staff, however it’s impossible to get any form of appointment. You call up at 8am exactly and then get put on hold for an hour and get told there no appointments. Or you get told that the serigraphy is closed and opens Monday-Friday at 8am….Surely there is a better system than this?

title: Professionalism and friendly
body: I was treated with kindness and after the scan I was given a short report of what was seen.i was on time and the dept was quiet and very clean and tidy.

title: Absolutely appalled!
body:
I am utterly appalled at how I have just been spoken to on the phone. 
I am nearly 37 weeks pregnant and having recently moved I am sourcing a new doctors. 
I simply called to ask how the practice works.
The lady on the phone was extremely rude telling me to look online. 
I explained I had and that I was hoping for some more information. She kept getting angry and said she doesn’t have time for my call because people are waiting. She told me to come in, I asked when’s best (I am still working) and she said look online. I have never been spoken to like this on the phone by a GP surgery and I think it is utterly shocking. I waited my turn on the call system and a minimum duty of care would be nice. 
Very very rude and she even hung up. 
Do not try and attempt to go here!

title: Sympathetic doctors
body: Got a same day appointment for an urgent issue - doctor took the time to listen.  Been at the practice since moving to Pinner and would recommend

title: Inaccessible
body: It is incredibly difficult to book an appointment : the system has no flexibility or options besides phoning on the day : You have a greater chance of winning the lottery .Sadly I have no other option than to leave

title: Great practice
body: Normally can get appointment and extended hours make it easier for an appointment with working hours.

title: unfortunately very good
body: Come out of hospital give all the paper work to the doctors for a repeat prescription the docsay they sent it to the pharmacy and the pharmacy said they didn't have it so left without pain meds after lung volume reduction surgery so I had to phone 111 to get more meds

title: always problems with prescriptions
body: In the last 6 months I've had 1 prescription lost, and 3 repeat prescriptions rejected without explanation. If there is a medical reason why a prescription can't be issued, I expect to be informed what it is.

title: Really good GP practice
body: I phoned today and got through immediately, a very helpful person listened to my request and sorted it pleasantly and quickly. What more can you ask? All GPS surgeries are under pressure and sometimes things don’t go right but in the 30+ years I and my family have been with this practice we’ve never had cause to complain

title: Terrible
body:
Terrible phone service 
Tried to book a routine gp appointment and after listening to the recorded message for 1 minute and pressed the appropriate option the line just cut off. 
Why tell you in the message that you can go in a queue when this does NoT happen and have to phone again and listen to it all AgAiN
I did not phone at a busy time in the day  -ie: 8.00am-9.00am

title: Excellent doctors
body: Efficient as always, only problem was that the self check in machine told me I was on ground floor and then they had to come and find me as it was first floor. This isn’t the first time this has happened to me.

title: Inadequate appointment system
body: Made appointment 2 weeks ago at GP request. I get there and I'm told its a phone appointment between 9:30 &1:30! How can blood pressure, weight, mood be assessed over the phone! Very disappointed as I can't take calls in work so making an appointment was a waste of time. Im told GPs make the face to face appointments after a phone call assessment. You get 10 minutes with GP for face to face appointment, instead you wait up to half a day on a call you might miss as you dont know when its coming...

title: Great practice
body: Always left with a better understanding of my medical condition. They also address the medical issues spot on and for the last 5 years, my diabetes is pretty well managed because of them.

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff have a perfect attitude
body:
Everything so far on the Male Medical Ward has been good. All the staff have been absolutely perfect – I really couldn’t say a bad word about any of them. All their explanations to me have been good. I couldn’t name anyone in particular as they have all been excellent. The staff have an absolutely perfect attitude – even with the abuse they can be subjected to sometimes.  
The ward has been both very clean and incredibly comfortable. It has also been quite quiet up here thankfully so I have had no issues sleeping. The bathrooms have all been kept clean. All the food I have had has also been perfect. The only issue with the bathrooms is that there are no mirrors.  
I have no suggestions for improvements – it has been a typical hospital stay for me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic Treatment & Speed in the Emergency Dept
body:
Having fallen off my two step, step ladder on Sunday evg whilst painting my fence panel and landing very awkwardly on my already 'damaged' bones/ body, three days later and suffering a lot more pain I decided I had better get checked out properly at Salford Hsptl.
I booked in around 1. 35pm and was leaving the Emergency Dept around 3pm having been assessed by two very warm and friendly professionals where I had it confirmed I had broken 2 ribs in my back. 😘
I was given a very thorough examination by a lovely Nurse and Male Doctor and was more than happy with my visit and experience there as always. 
Thank you again to you both.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Great experience
body: Going to spamedica I was apprehensive about the procedure but I was soon put at ease when I met the surgeon, he asked if I had any questions about the procedure and put my mind at ease on all the points I asked. I was booked in at 8am and it was all done for 9-30

title: Wow how rude
body: From calling reception to make appointment was a very stressful experience as receptionist is very rude cuts you off mid sentence to not answer directly just gives rude remark or put on hold mid sentence very unpleasant experience can’t get appointments but doctor has time to write on behalf of receptionist its got worse and worse as there is not many options in the area they seem to think they can treat people like something they trod in bad atmosphere all around I’m afraid that’s if and when you can get through so when she puts the phone down yes another hour trying terrible service should be ashamed you would not be able to act like this in any other job/profession

title: Awful
body:
If you have a chronic medical condition don’t expect this surgery to care in the slightest 
Bit was diagnosed with ms after many trips the hospital as couldn’t get in to see my gp since then my doctor has had no contact with me to see how I’m doing if the treatment is going ok nothing started having issues relating to ms so made an appointment waited a month for said face to face appointment to be rang that morning and told it would a phone appointment now 
So basically they can’t be bothered to see me 
They are completely useless and have no patient care

title: Phone call back
body: I phoned for a call back this morning.i got through around half eight and was told the appointments are full,how can they be full, they've only been open half an hour

title: Great surgery
body: The surgery was great, it was all done according to plan . The staff were very professional and the place was clean.

title: Great practice
body: I went in for a smear, whilst telling nurse of other symptoms I got a callback from doctor, I had another appointment within the same day for a urine test followed by a blood test the following day. Super fast service. I cannot fault them.

title: Poor Prioritisation in A&E
body: Having arrived by ambulance with serious injuries from a fall, I was amazed that despite my obvious poor state (I was covered in a lot of blood and had head and other injuries), others that were in the waiting room who were sitting and chatting, reading books etc were seen ahead of myself.  Surely there should be a system to deal with more serious cases than those cases that look to be less urgent?

title: What on earth is going on at the moment
body:
As prr the title. Very limited hours askmygp is open, nigh on impossible to get through on the phone, can be No1 in the queue for 5 mins then get hung up on. Cherry surgery is barely utilised.
Normally the service is top notch and lve always thought it was brilliant, the last month however has been dire unfortunately.
People want/need to know the reason so they can understand why it is happening which makes people a lot more tolerant.
Put a notice on the website, if docs have left or whatever the reason just say as social media is going bonkers about it now.
I do apologise as l know how hard the guys work and its not their fault.

title: Quick response
body: From completing an e consult to seeing my GP took less than a week for a non urgent problem, very impressed

title: No appointments
body:
Tried daily for 2 weeks to arrange an appointment to be told each time there were no appointments and to try tomorrow.
Condition now worsening and seems to be no concern/regard for patient care.

title: Terrible receptionist
body: I was trying to make an appointment and the receptionist kept talking to a colleague she clearly wasn't listening to me as I had to repeat myself numerous times. This is extremely rude and unprofessional!

author: Newhip23
title: Grateful for very personable, caring and helpful staff
body:
Had hip replacement surgery in the the new Fife Orthopaedic Centre at Kirkcaldy. Had the surgery late morning, and was home that evening.  
All staff throughout the day were brilliant. Some 8 weeks later the post surgical healing is going really well. I have rarely needed to use painkillers - and that was only paracetamol now and then during the first couple of weeks of recovery.  
Am truly grateful for very personable, caring and helpful staff - I felt encouraged all the way through. I was also impressed with post surgery care and that I could call for advice at any time. Well done and thank you.  
[Unsure about 'Explanations']  
  
[Unsure about 'Introductions']  
  
[Unsure about 'Care staff']  
  
[Unsure about 'Doctor']

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

author: BriMar82
title: Perfect example of how good our NHS is
body:
After a referral by my GP I received an appointment to attend the Radiology department for a scan in the Omagh Hospital Primary Care Complex.  
On the appointed date I checked in with the receptionist at the radiology department and I was asked to take a seat in the waiting area. Within a few minutes my name was called.  
The radiologist was very pleasant introducing herself and explained the procedure putting me at ease (not that I was overly concerned), but she was lovely and I was able to relax.  
My scan took approximately 15/20 minutes and I believe the radiologist was very thorough taking time to explain as she scanned the concerned area of my body.  
It was a very positive experience. Perfect example of how good our NHS is, how well they provide for us and how lucky we are to have it.  
Thankyou

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Absolutely appalling
body: I have been Ill for 3mths seen by 1 GP in all this time my symptoms are far worse than they were I have told the receptionist I’m gravely concerned about how poorly I feel, got told 2 weeks for a blood test unless I done them myself as I’m a nurse which I had to do, got a telephone call from the receptionist to ask if I’m available in a weeks time to actually see a GP, this triage system is not working and get told to ring 111 all the time this is awful to leave people in pain and worried for there health and there mental health, what should it take to see a GP at this surgery? Plus I have Bipolar Disorder and my mental state is suffering. But they don’t care at all don’t see why they take an oath if they don’t want to be a GP

title: Service with care
body:
I had a positive experience using this service, in fact my appointment was brought forward to the date that l booked the consultation.
The appointment was schedule via video. Unfortunately l had technical difficulties and despite this fact the Pharmacist did not abort the consultation and was patient. The Pharmacist was attentive , polite and above all very informative. Thank you

title: Hip and knee pain review
body: I am having a problem with my hip theirs a pain on it ,so today I got a call from the GP  and discussed the issue. What I liked the most was that I got to understand the GP . She told me what to do and how to deal with the situation . Now got some meds and feeling much better.

title: Great practice
body: Fantastic, I explained my symptoms they looked at my past medical history and advise what’s best steps to take. I recommend to anyone because unlike my previous Gp I felt like I was the doctor they weren’t sure what to give to me and ask me what I thought my symptoms were and that they don’t know either instead to do further research like give me bloods or refer me they just quick to give antibiotics but this Gp are amazing they know their stuff. Thank you best Gp practise I ever used ;)

title: Autism assessment
body:
From start to finish the process was 10 months, much quicker than we had anticipated. The Drs for the assessment were fun and the Dr for the conclusion was kind and informative. 
This was our second child's assessment with Psicon and we were very pleased both times with the process

title: Great Service
body: Been a customer for 5 years no problem but when I last asked for cannula I was just left with 2 I have oxygen in 3 rooms and portable oxygen so the left me a bit short maybe ask the customer how many are needed would be a good idea that is my only moan great service great technicals.👍👍.

title: New triage system not fit for purpose
body:
The new Accurx triage system is not fit for purpose as it is constantly turned off early, and the receptionists can't / won't help make appointments after that time, simply repeating "log in at 0600 tomorrow / Monday". There is no recognition of the fact many people are unable to do this early in the morning. There must be a facility to use the triage system later in the day rather than it being turned off at an arbitrary time each morning - why not turn it on from say 0900-1200 and 1500-1800 each day giving everyone a fair chance to access their GP? 0600 to an unknown time in the morning is not reasonable.

Furthermore, and probably more importantly, when you have an ongoing issue being investigated and require a series of follow-up appointments with a named GP, why are patients forced to go through the triage system anyway? In these cases, common sense should be applied and the receptionists should be empowered to make the follow-up appointment over the phone. Even better would be if whichever triage system was in use required a login with a username / password so patients could add additional info and requests for follow-ups to their case history at any time.

The old Patient Access system was the best when the practice used that as you could log in and select an appointment at a convenient time. Now, if you receive an appointment, no notice is taken of your availability, which is frustrating for those who work full time and have many time commitments.

The GPs at Speedwell are excellent but it's frustrating and upsetting that the practice has made it so hostile for some sections of the community and those requiring follow-up to access its services. Technology is great but it's not being used effectively here, almost just as an overlay to existing manual systems, which is the worst of both worlds.
